extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup plus 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour

extendedIngredients.name: oreo cookies
extendedIngredients.originalString: 20 Oreo cookies, ground to fine crumbs

recipes.title: No Bake Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Cheesecake

winePairing.pairingText: Cake works really well with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Solera Cream Sherry with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a medium bowl, mix together Oreos and butter. Press crumbs into the bottom of a pie plate, it's okay if the crumbs come up the sides of the plate a bit.In a medium bowl, beat together butter and sugar until smooth, about 1 minute. Add vanilla and milk; mix to combine.in a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, and mix until just combined.Using a spoon, mix in the rolled oats and chocolate chips by hand.Flatten the cookie dough into a disc between two pieces of plastic wrap. Place the cookie dough in top of the Oreo crust, and carefully press out towards to edges of the pie plate.Fold the cream cheese into the whipped topping until well combined. Spread the cream cheese mixture over the cookie dough, evenly, to the edges of the pie plate.Place dark chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave the chocolate chips for 1 minute, then stir. Microwave for another 30 seconds, stir chocolate. Repeat until chocolate is melted and smooth. DO NOT over cook or chocolate will seize up.Using a spoon, drizzle melted chocolate over the top of the cheesecake to your liking. Sprinkle mini chocolate chips everywhere!Refrigerate to set chocolate. Keep cold until ready to serve.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, mix together Oreos and butter. Press crumbs into the bottom of a pie plate, it's okay if the crumbs come up the sides of the plate a bit.In a medium bowl, beat together butter and sugar until smooth, about 1 minute.
Add vanilla and milk; mix to combine.in a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.

Add flour mixture to butter mixture, and mix until just combined.Using a spoon, mix in the rolled oats and chocolate chips by hand.Flatten the cookie dough into a disc between two pieces of plastic wrap.
Place the cookie dough in top of the Oreo crust, and carefully press out towards to edges of the pie plate.Fold the cream cheese into the whipped topping until well combined.
Spread the cream cheese mixture over the cookie dough, evenly, to the edges of the pie plate.

Place dark chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave the chocolate chips for 1 minute, then stir. Microwave for another 30 seconds, stir chocolate. Repeat until chocolate is melted and smooth. DO NOT over cook or chocolate will seize up.Using a spoon, drizzle melted chocolate over the top of the cheesecake to your liking. Sprinkle mini chocolate chips everywhere!Refrigerate to set chocolate. Keep cold until ready to serve.
